title: Auto-imports
description: Nuxt Kit provides a set of utilities to help you work with auto-imports. These functions allow you to register your own utils, composables and Vue APIs.

children.value: Nuxt auto-imports helper functions, composables and Vue APIs to use across your application without explicitly importing them. Based on the directory structure, every Nuxt application can also use auto-imports for its own composables and plugins. With Nuxt Kit you can also add your own auto-imports.
allow you to add imports to the Nuxt application.
allows you to add listed imports from 3rd party packages to the Nuxt application.
These functions are designed for registering your own utils, composables and Vue APIs. For pages, components and plugins, please refer to the specific sections:

Nuxt auto-imports helper functions, composables and Vue APIs to use across your application without explicitly importing them. Based on the directory structure, every Nuxt application can also use auto-imports for its own composables and plugins. Composables or plugins can use these functions.
Watch Vue School video about Auto-imports Nuxt Kit utilities.
Add imports to the Nuxt application. It makes your imports available in the Nuxt application without the need to import them manually.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
function addImports (imports: Import | Import[]): void

interface Import {
  from: string
  priority?: number
  disabled?: boolean
  meta?: {
    description?: string
    docsUrl?: string
    [key: string]: any
  }
  type?: boolean
  typeFrom?: string
  name: string
  as?: string
}

children.value: An object or an array of objects with the following properties:
Priority of the import, if multiple imports have the same name, the one with the highest priority will be used.
If this import is a pure type import.
Using this as the from when generating type declarations.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: Add imports from a directory to the Nuxt application. It will automatically import all files from the directory and make them available in the Nuxt application without the need to import them manually.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code: function addImportsDir (dirs: string | string[], options?: { prepend?: boolean }): void

children.value: A string or an array of strings with the path to the directory to import from.
Options to pass to the import. If
, the imports will be prepended to the list of imports.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: Add listed imports to the Nuxt application.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: An object or an array of objects with the following properties:
An object or an array of objects, which can be import names, import objects or import sources.
Priority of the import, if multiple imports have the same name, the one with the highest priority will be used.
If this import is a pure type import.
Using this as the from when generating type declarations.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: // add imports from h3 to make them autoimported

html .light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html.light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
